title: Comparison of limits of various functions

content.question:
Which of the following limits are equal to −1 ?

<math> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi></mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup> <mn>0</mn> <mo>−</mo> </msup> </mrow> </munder> <mfrac> <mrow> <mrow><mo>|</mo> <mtext>x</mtext> <mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi></mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow> </munder> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mi>∞</mi> </mrow> </munder> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
